intro: Hieracium fendleri, commonly known as the desert hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium fendleri plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain insects.
